data.message:
Not bad on an overall scale but the controls are super hard. Having to keep the mobile leveled at a 90° angle, very uncomfortable. 

Nonetheless, the sensitivity is much better than your previous game so that's progress right there.

The menu and HUD need a lot of work, there should also be some way to turn off the music/sound volume.
When I started playing and wanted to leave, the back button didn't do much, I eventually had to pause and click Main Menu.

Finally, you probably played beach head before, beach head got boring pretty quickly but was still fun to play because they did a fantastic job at keeping the game intense and its difficultly escalated pretty quickly.

They also constrainted the view angle so you only had a limited FOV to worry about, I think your best bet with this game being unique enough is ditching the open landscape. 

Imagine the player garrisoned in a building that's about to fall apart, the players job is to secure the building from multiple fixed points, say two or three windows that overlook a couple of street corners in a town being overrun by Germans, Aliens or god knows what,  zombies work too :D
This gives you a controlled environment, with little art work to worry about and much more exciting game play mechanics

Not to mention the plot would make much more sense.

Beach head took the shooter genre to a whole new level and a couple of others as well, they pioneered the mechanics but failed on the overall scenery challenge, plot and mechanics variety.

Good luck.
